availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Henry W. Royalty (Barren County, KY, resident)

body.p: Barren County, Kentucky, resident and Warren County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Elmina Wright Ferguson Royalty in Warren County on July 28, 1839. Father of Adaline Royalty, Mary S. Royalty, John Royalty, Sarah B. Royalty, Bell S. Royalty, and Nelly M. Royalty. Stepfather of Elizabeth W. Ferguson and Linus J. Ferguson. Farmer in Warren County in 1850. Resident in Barren County in 1860. Hotel keeper in Glasgow, Kentucky, in 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, District 2, p.109A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Barren County, District 1, p. 764.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Warren County Marriages, 1796-1913, Film #000164004, p. 292 of 495.
Find A Grave, "Henry Warren Royalty, Jr. (1815-1882)," Memorial 110557441, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/110557441/henry-warren-royalty (accessed June 25, 2020).
